# Matrix operations - form_matrix(list,row,col) - creates matrix of rowxcol dimension from a list
- sm(M,name) - show matrix in goodlooking form also display name of the matrix
- filtermatrix(M) - converts numbers smaller than 10^-6 to 0 in a matrix(for more accurate rank calculations)
- minor(M,row,col) - finds minor of Mij
- determinant(M) - finds determinant of M using Laplace expansion
- transpose(M) - finds transpose of M
- inverse(M) - finds inverse of M
- product(A,B) - finds product of A and B
- conjugatematrix(M) - finds conjugate of M
- dagger(M) - finds dagger of M
- trace(M) - finds the trace of M
- aresame(A,B) - checks equality of A and B, returns boolean
- Id(sign,n) - creates a nxn identity matrix
- isHermitian(M) - check if M is hermitian, returns 1,0,-1
- isUnitary(M) - check if M is unitary, returns boolean
- isSymmetric(M) - check if M is symmetric,returns 1,0,-1
- isOrthogonal(M) - check if M is orthogonal returns boolean
- add(A,B) - finds the sum of A and B
- Zero(row,col) - creates a rowxcol dimension zero matrix
- commutator(A,B) - finds the commutator of A and B
- norm(V) - finds norm of 1D matrix(vector)
- rank(M) - finds the rank of the matrix
- normaize(M) - normalizes a vector
- GS(M) - takes a matrix as input where the coloumns forms the set of vectors and returns dict of orthonormalized vectors
- zerocounter(l) - takes a list and returns the number of zeroes in it
- rowswitch(M,rowi,rowj) - ith row <-> jth row
- colswitch(M,coli,colj) - ith col <-> jth col
- rowmultiply(M,row,scalar) - ith row -> scalar * ith row
- rowadd(M,rowi,rowj,scalar) - ith row -> ith row + scalar * jth row
- REF(M) - reduces M to row echelon form using Gaussian elimination
- rank(M) - finds rank of M
- Cramersolve(M) - solves the simultaneous linear equations of the form Mx = b using, M is a matrix, b is a list
- GEsolve(M) - solves the simultaneous linear equations after reducing to row echelon form, M is the augmented matrix
- `LU(M) - decomposes M into a lower triangular matrix L and upper triangular matrix U
- `QR(M) - decomposes M to unitary Q and upper triangular R
- `Eigenval(M) - finds the eigenvalues if M via QR algorithm
- `Eigenvect(M) - finds the eigenvectord of M
